page.title: 03Housing in Gotherington
page.content: There are many different types of houses in Gotherington.They have to be built in special Cotswold brick.The oldest house is opposite Moat Farm.It dates back to Elizabethan times.There are also old houses which were part of the Gotherington Estate.Over the last hundred years the village has quadrupled in the number of houses it contains.Most of the new houses have been built between existing houses on small plots of land.The most recent building has been completed opposite Moat Farm and by Ryman's shop. You can buy a normal house for Â£72000.A new bungalow would cost about Â£80000.There are also some new houses near the post office and the butcher's shop. The old school is being converted into two houses after being sold for Â£50000 in February 1985.
